page.title: 08Upton Church
page.content: In 1845 when Archdeacon Stonehouse visited the church he noticed that it was in great need of repair.However it appears from recorded evidence that no major restoration work was carried out until 1867 when it is stated in the Parish records that the state ot the church was lamentable.However substantial repairs were undertaken by the architect Evan Christian at the cost of Â£1,000.Parts of the walls were rebuilt as well as the chapel arch,a new roof was put on the nave and the tower masonry was re-pointed.The old pews were unfortunately removed and new ones provided. Seven years later the old North aisle was re-opened under the direction of James Fowler of{Louth.}In 1880 the Tower was eventually repaired.The costs of the work between 1874 and 1880 was Â£3,495.
